channel.title: How?
channel.description: How did people make private servers. i dont mean like how to make em, how did they get the info? Did they hack the files from JaGex? Did they make them? Did they make the models? Or steal them. How?

item.title: How?
item.dc:creator: @Kalphiter Kalphiter
item.description:
@Kalphiter wrote:

[quote=“Rog3r, post:2, topic:244149”]client was hacked.[/quote]Yes… that’s why all the variable/integer names are like:

anInt####

because their names are never stored when compiled. Whatever you name it is for source reference.

In other words, fixed variables(like PlayerHandler.MessageToAll) will be still there when compiled then decompiled.(because it’s a fixed path)

Variables that can change will not.

Decompilers typically have different names for re-naming integers.

Like s1 for the 1st string found in the document or anInt#### in this case.

Read full topic

item.title: How?
item.dc:creator: @Rog3r Rog3r
item.description:
@Rog3r wrote:

Made the servers from scratch, client was hacked.
